item.description: Explore the biodiversity of plant and animal life that lives in and around a cranberry bog while learning about this native fruit and the bog iron boom that preceded the cranberry bog industry in this area. Hike will take place on Thursday, September 16th from 10:00am to 11:30am. Meet at the parking lot off Bare Hill Road (near Rocky Pond). Lot is about 10 minutes from Headquarters which is located at 194 Cranberry Road, South Carver. See trail map. Dress for the weather and wear good shoes. This program is best for adults and children 6+. All children must be accompanied by an adult. No strollers please. Rain or storm will cancel. Call Amy at (508) 272-9376 for more information. For park information, visit http://www.mass.gov/d.... This program is sponsored by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation & Recreation.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Rocky Pond Cranberry Bog Hike at Myles Standish State Forest
